name: Binary Eye
description:
Yet another barcode scanner. Works in portrait and landscape mode, can read inverted barcodes, reads barcodes with binary data and can also generate barcodes.

Uses the ZXing ("Zebra Crossing") barcode scanning library. Reads and writes all barcode formats (QR Code, Aztec, etc.) ZXing can read and write.

name: Pie Launcher
description:
Android home screen launcher that uses a dynamic pie menu instead of tables of icons. Here's a video of it.

Once you get used to it, you can launch your most frequently used apps using muscle memory without even looking at the screen.

Apps you don't use regularly are quickly available with just one tap and by typing the first one or two letters of the app name.

name: Shader Editor
description:
Create GLSL shaders on your Android phone and use them as live wallpaper. Exposes many sensors of your smartphone for shader programming. Like the gyroscope or the magnetic field sensor, for example.

An app for people interested in graphics programming and customizing the screen of their smartphone.

Includes some samples to get started like a Game of Life shader you can touch. Here's another sample.

name: Wave Lines Wallpaper
description:
A live wallpaper with colorful, slowly moving wavy lines.

You can either choose a predefined theme, edit a theme to your liking, or simply create your own.

I actually wrote the first version of this app on an Android device.

name: Decisions
description:
Helps making decisions. Works like this:

  1. Write down pros and cons
  2. Weigh arguments from 1 to 10
  3. Get a recommendation

Inspired by this Time article.

name: Moto Score
description:
Tally counter for motorcyclists to record tours and mistakes (i.e. everything you wouldn't do again).

Because according to The Upper Half of the Motorcycle, consciously counting mistakes stimulates learning.

The prototype of this app was written and presented at "Hack The Ride", a hackathon held by BMW Motorrad in Barcelona 2014.

name: Screen Time
description:
Displays your screen time in a permanent notification.

By making screen time more prominent, you can get a better sense of how much of the day you spend on your phone. Without judgement. Just so you know.

Of course, there's Google's Digital Wellbeing app and a lot of other apps that track app usage. But I just like to see my screen time at a glance without having to open an app.

name: PieDock
description:
PieDock is a task bar and application launcher in shape of a pie menu for the X Window System. Feels a little bit like the famous OS X dock in a circle.

Here is a video of the concept in action. Also made a home screen launcher for Android with the same idea. And a JavaScript version for the web.

name: bbdock
description: Displays transparent PNG icons in the Blackbox, Openbox or Fluxbox slit. If this is greek to you, you don't need it.

name: Was ist los um Nürnberg?
description:
Simple, searchable list of what to do around Nuremberg, Germany.

This was written just before the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic, and some of the sources have since dried up. Hopefully only transitionally.

name: qrim
description:
Merge a QR Code with any background image. Modifies the source image only where necessary.

This exploits the fact that barcode reading is based on contrast differences. Started as an experiment to see how far you could go.

Please keep in mind that QR Codes like this are naturally harder to read and that not every QR Code scanner might be able to read them. You may use the sliders to find a reliable configuration for your background image and make sure to test the result with different scanners.

name: Soyuz 404
description:
A space adventure in 13 kilobytes you can play through during your lunch break.

Works on your phone, too. Hold and move your finger on the screen to explore a scene. When you lift your finger over something, that something is used.

This is a slightly improved version of a game I wrote for js13kgames 2020.

PS: the formula, which plays a significant role in the game, is not made up, but the real spacetime interval equation.

name: Bad Minton
description:
Monochrome Pong/Card mashup.

Also works well on your phone. In fact, the two player mode is meant to be played on a mobile unless you have two mice on your desktop.

Written for Ludum Dare #41.

name: GalEx
description:
Be a daredevil space pilot and deliver interplanetary mail to connect worlds. But watch out, gravity is fun but dangerous!

There are 11 missions waiting for you. At the end, the game displays the net playing time of all successful attempts. Everything under 2 minutes would be pretty good.

Works on any device with a decent web browser. This is an enhanced version of a game I wrote for Ludum Dare #30.

name: Gingerman
description:
Help Gingerman to get to the top of the Christmas tree. Jump on anything that does not burn to climb the tree.

Works on any device with a decent web browser. Written around and for the Christmas season for Ludum Dare #31. This is an enhanced version.

name: Saving Oskar
description:
Try and save your dear lamb Oskar from being sacrificed.

The gods demand a sacrifice and so a lamb must die. But not Oskar, your dear friend. So you need to sacrifice another lamb. Again and again. Until all lambs are sacrificed, except Oskar. Then, and only then, the gods will be pleased and you win the game.

Made this game for Ludum Dare #43 with Christian Braun, who did almost all the graphics and all the music.

name: Jumpy Green
description:
A little green man trying to get evil astronauts off his small world.

Get rid of Buck Rodgers by jumping high and landing hard when he is on the opposite side of your world. If you jump high enough, he will be thrown off your world and get lost in space again.

Written for Ludum Dare #38.

name: Ten Seconds To Venus
description:
Express point-and-click riddle.

You are on board of a space station in Venus orbit. You are sleeping. Then you wake from a roaring BANG! You have just ten seconds until the ship will be destroyed…

Made for Ludum Dare #27.

name: Ski Run
description:
Ski racing game for two players on one screen.

Works on any screen with a decent web browser. Originally written for Ludum Dare #28 but never submitted.

name: Striker
description:
Fast vertical shoot 'em up. Shoot down as many enemy vessels as possible.

Does not work on mobile because it was written in 2002. Originally made as an easter egg for a boring business website that doesn't exist anymore.

name: Sheeptris
description:
A multiplayer Tetris with sheeps. Can be played by up to three players simultaneously.

Originally, this game was also playable in a web browser. But since Java applets have fallen out of favor, that no longer works. So not only do you have to download the game, but you also have to have Java installed to run it.

name: Bots
description:
Programming game about bots that move on a grid.

To play the game, your program, a so-called bot, must connect a socket to the Bots server. The bot can be programmed in any language that can open a socket.

Used for the KURZ Digital Coding Night 2018 and 2019.

info: js13kGames is a JavaScript coding competition with a file size limit of 13 kilobytes.

name: Humwin & Darbold
description:
A small action adventure for js13kGames 2021 "Space". 12703 bytes (95%).

Humwin, your friendly space exploring robot, is in search for his pal Darbold, who has gone missing on a strange planet. What happened to him and where is he?

Unfortunately, the game turned out to be too unforgiving and I failed to make the solution clear. So here's a hopefully better post-compo version.

name: Soyuz 404
description:
A space adventure for js13kGames 2020 "404". 13298 bytes (99%).

The game and a few details about it were mentioned in this video summary of the 2020 event.

name: Conflict Management
description: A turn-based game about conflict management like it was back in the day for js13kGames 2019 "back". 10128 bytes (76%).

name: Pronto
description: Simple reaction game for js13kGames 2018 "offline". 6923 bytes (51%).

name: Lost Treasures
description: Dive to find coins for js13kGames 2017 "Lost". 7928 bytes (59%).

name: Glitch Yeagers
description: Air combat for js13kGames 2016 "Glitch". 6917 bytes (52%).

name: Eugor
description: Roguelike for js13kGames 2015 "Reversed". 7126 bytes (53%).

info: Ludum Dare is one of the world's largest and longest running Game Jam events.

name: Nine Lives
description: Nine lives aren't enough for Ludum Dare #44 "Your life is currency".

name: Saving Oskar
description: Try and save your dear lamb Oskar from being sacrificed. Made with Christian Braun for Ludum Dare #43 "Sacrifices must be made".

name: Bad Minton
description: Monochrome Pong/Card mashup for Ludum Dare #41 "Combine 2 Incompatible Genres".

name: Rogues
description: Multiplayer multi-device game about stealing gold for Ludum Dare #40 "The more you have, the worse it is". Playable with friends only.

name: Jumpy Green
description: A little green man trying to get evil astronauts off his small world for Ludum Dare #38 "A Small World". Playable.

name: Robot Clash
description: Multiplayer multi-device turn-based death match for Ludum Dare #37 "One Room". Playable with friends only.

name: Rubiks Plane
description: Shifting puzzler for Ludum Dare #35 "Shapeshift". Playable.

name: Sweet Tooth Mouse
description: Prototype game of a mouse and a lot of sweets for Ludum Dare #34 "Growing". Ran out of time.

name: 00Q And The Horrible Tiger Gun
description: Her Majesty's Only Field Test Spy™ hard in action for Ludum Dare #32 "An Unconventional Weapon". Just two very simple levels. Ran out of time. And there's no way to fire that gun on a touch device, sorry.

name: Gingerman
description: Christmas game for Ludum Dare #31 "Entire Game on One Screen". Playable.

name: GalEx
description: Deliver mail in space for Ludum Dare #30 "Connected Worlds". Playable.

name: Tycho
description: Prototype game about finding crystals on a blue planet for Ludum Dare #29 "Beneath the Surface". Playable but _very_ simple. Ran out of time.

name: Ten Seconds To Venus
description: Astronaut game for Ludum Dare #27 "10 Seconds". Playable.

name: quadTRI
description: Two player game about matching triangles for Ludum Dare #26 "Minimalism". Playable with a friend.

name: Alien Invasion
description: Prototype game for Ludum Dare #25 "You Are The Villain". Playable.

info: 0h Game Jam is a coding competition that takes place during DST hour shift.

name: Huh
description:
Click on a free spot to survive. Made for 0h Game Jam 2014.

Here is the time-lapse video of the hour that never was.

name: CameraView
description:
A view that shows what the camera sees.

Supports orientation changes, fits the preview image into the available view space and works with Gingerbread (minSDK 9) or better.

name: ScalingImageView
description:
An ImageView that transforms its drawable according to touch input.

Supports rotated images and keeps transformation when you exchange the image for another one with a different size.

name: SwipeImageView
description:
An ImageView that can be used to swipe between images and supports pinch/zoom gestures to explore the current image.

Think of Google Photos.

name: libhttp
description:
Light-weight C library for HTTP/1.1 requests.

Build for embedded environments or whereever libcurl would be just too much.

name: libxml
description:
Incremental XML parser in plain C.

Processes XML input in chunks without caching the entire document.

name: cpprc
description:
Embed data files into C++. What "xxd -i" does for C.

Like "qtrc" from Qt but for wxWidgets and the C++ STL.

name: calc
description:
Tiny line calculator in portable C.

A humble bc alternative.

name: dotfiles
description:
The terminal is my IDE and this is my configuration.

Find here some shell scripts that make my life easier.

name: annual
description:
Generate an annual report from your local git repositories.

Here are my reports since I started using git, professional and personal repositories combined.

name: simsalabash
description:
Dead simple static site generator for command line lovers.

This website is built using it. Yes, sometimes I fall prey to the NIH syndrome. On purpose.

name: readmail
description: POP3/SMTP client in bash.

name: Advent of AWK 2020
description: AWK solutions for Advent of Code 2020.

name: mkatlas
description: Create a texture atlas in bash with ImageMagick.

name: tree
description: Show a file listing as tree structure.

name: bars
description: Print horizontal bar diagrams from a list of values.

name: takahashi
description:
Create a single file web presentation from a Markdown document.

This is for you if you like Markdown and the Takahashi method.

name: sqlc
description:
Quick and dirty SQL web console for PHP5+.

Helpful when you don't have shell access to the database server.

name: Phapp
description:
Scalable object-oriented web application framework for PHP5+.

I've used this on many personal and professional web application projects.

name: simsala
description:
Static site editor and generator.

Uses Phapp and contains a PHP port of simsalabash.

name: TouchClockJs
description: A clock you can touch (or click) to set a time and (optionally) a duration.

name: WebPie
description:
A zooming pie menu for web pages.

Uses the same algorithm as Pie Launcher and PieDock.

name: ZoomGrid
description:
A two-dimensional accordion menu inside a fixed rectangle.

Originally written and used for my 2011 website.

name: Kartpokal Franken Relaunch 2012
description:
Was an indoor go-kart championship for everyone.

I raced in the team "KRC Schwabach".
